form.longName: PhenX PX510102 - Family History Of Substance Use Problems Drugs
form.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule -IV (AUDADIS-IV) is a fully structured diagnostic interview designed to assess alcohol, drug, and mental disorders according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV), diagnostic criteria in both clinical and general populations. Section 3E of AUDADIS-IV assesses a respondent's family history of drug problems.

module.longName: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Drugs
module.preferredDefinition: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Drugs

question.questionText: 1. In your judgment, has your blood or natural father had/did your blood or natural father have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? (father_problem_drugs)
2. Has your blood or natural mother had/did your blood or natural mother have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? (mother_problem_drugs)

3a. How many full brothers have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (pxt510102_number_full_brothers)

3a. How many full brothers have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (pxt510102_number_full2_f85)
3b. Did your full brother have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? (brother_problem_drugs)
3c, How many of your full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_brothers_problem_drugs)
3c, How many of your full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_brothers_probl2_142)

4a, How many full sisters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (pxt510102_number_full_sisters)

4a, How many full sisters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (pxt510102_number_full2_601)
4b. Did your full sister have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? (sister_problem_drugs)
4c. How many of your full sisters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_sisters_problem_drugs)
4c. How many of your full sisters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_sisters_proble2_4b8)

5a. How many natural sons have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (pxt510102_number_natural_sons)

5a. How many natural sons have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (pxt510102_number_natu2_bb9)
5b. Did your natural son have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? (son_problem_drugs)
5c. How many of your natural sons had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_sons_problem_drugs)
5c. How many of your natural sons had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_sons_problem_d2_492)

6a. How many natural daughters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (pxt510102_number_natural_daughters)

6a. How many natural daughters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (pxt510102_number_natu2_841)
6b. Did your natural daughter have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? (daughter_problem_drugs)
6c. How many of your natural daughters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_daughters_problem_drugs)
6c. How many of your natural daughters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_daughters_prob2_637)

7a. How many full brothers did your natural father have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your father. (pxt510102_number_natural_paternal_uncles)

7a. How many full brothers did your natural father have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your father. (pxt510102_number_natu2_2de)
7b. Did your natural father's full brother have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? (paternal_uncle_problem_drugs)
7c. How many of your natural father's full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_paternal_uncles_problem_drugs)
7c. How many of your natural father's full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_paternal_uncle2_f24)

8a. How many full sisters did your natural father have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your father. (pxt510102_number_natural_paternal_aunts)

8a. How many full sisters did your natural father have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your father. (pxt510102_number_natu2_e6d)
8b. Did your natural father's full sister have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? (paternal_aunt_problem_drugs)
8c. How many of your natural father's full sisters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_paternal_aunts_problem_drugs)
8c. How many of your natural father's full sisters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_paternal_aunts2_73d)

9a. How many full brothers did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your mother. (pxt510102_number_natural_maternal_uncles)

9a. How many full brothers did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your mother. (pxt510102_number_natu2_ff4)
9b. Did your natural mother's full brother have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? (maternal_uncle_problem_drugs)
9c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_maternal_uncles_problem_drugs)
9c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_maternal_uncle2_ffc)

10a. How many full sisters did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your mother. (pxt510102_number_natural_maternal_aunts)

10a. How many full sisters did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as your mother. (pxt510102_number_natu2_912)
10b. Did your natural mother's full sister have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? (maternal_aunt_problem_drugs)
10c. How many of your natural mother's full sisters had problems with drugs at ANY time in their lives? (number_maternal_aunts_problem_drugs)

11. Did your natural grandfather on your father's side have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? By natural grandfather on your father's side, I mean your father's natural or blood father. (paternal_grandfather_problem_drugs)

12. Did your natural grandmother on your father's side have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? By natural grandmother on your father's side, I mean your father's natural or blood mother. (paternal_grandmother_problem_drugs)

13. Did your natural grandfather on your mother's side have problems with drugs at ANY time in his life? By natural grandfather on your mother's side, I mean your mother's natural or blood father. (maternal_grandfather_problem_drugs)

14. Did your natural grandmother on your mother's side have problems with drugs at ANY time in her life? By natural grandmother on your mother's side, I mean your mother's natural or blood mother. (maternal_grandmother_problem_drugs)
15. Were you EVER married to someone who had problems with drugs? (married_to_someone_problem_drugs)
16. Is that your current (husband/wife)? (current_spouse_problem_drugs)
17. Would you say that (he/she) has problems with drugs at this time? (current_spouse_problem_drugs_now)
18. Did you EVER live with someone as if you were married? (pxt510102_live_with_someone)
19. Did you EVER live as if married with someone who had problems with drugs? (live_with_someone_problem_drugs)
20. Is that the person you live with now? (live_with_someone_now_problem_drugs)
21. Would you say that (he/she) has drug problems at this time? (live_with_someone_problem_drugs_currently)

Now I would like to ask you some questions about whether your relatives, regardless of whether or not they are now living, have EVER had problems with drugs. By having problems with drugs, I mean a person who has physical or emotional problems because of drug use (PAUSE) problems with a spouse/partner, family, or friends because of drug use (PAUSE) problems at work or school because of drug use (PAUSE) problems with the police because of drug uselike driving under the influence (PAUSE) or a person who seems to spend a lot of time using drugs or getting over their bad aftereffects. (Repeat definition frequently.) (inst_510102)

protocol.longName: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule -IV (AUDADIS-IV) is a fully structured diagnostic interview designed to assess alcohol, drug, and mental disorders according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV), diagnostic criteria in both clinical and general populations. Section 3E of AUDADIS-IV assesses a respondent's family history of drug problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX510204 - Screen And Sev Of Subst Use Problems Adults Drugs
form.preferredDefinition: The 10-item Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10) includes questions about the respondent's use of drugs and related health effects and behaviors. It is used as a quantitative indicator of the respondent's drug-related problems.

headerInstruction.text: The following questions concern information about your possible involvement with drugs not including alcoholic beverages during the past 12 months. Carefully read each statement and decide if your answer is "Yes" or "No". Then, circle the appr..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Drugs
module.preferredDefinition: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Drugs

question.questionText: 1. Have you used drugs other than those required for medical reasons? (used_drugs)
2. Do you abuse more than one drug at a time? (more_than_one_drug)
3. Are you always able to stop using drugs when you want to? (able_to_stop_using_drugs)
4. Have you had 'blackouts' or 'flashbacks' as a result of drug use? (blackouts_flashbacks)
5. Do you feel very bad or guilty about your drug use? (feel_guilty_about_drug_use)
6. Does your spouse (or parents) ever complain about your involvement with drugs? (spouse_complains_about_drugs)
7. Have you neglected your family because of your use of drugs? (neglected_family_because_of_drugs)
8. Have you engaged in illegal activities in order to obtain drugs? (illegal_activities_to_obtain_drugs)
9. Have you ever experienced withdrawal symptoms (felt sick) when you stopped taking drugs? (experienced_withdrawal_symptoms)
10. Have you ever had medical problems as a result of your drug use (e.g., memory loss, hepatitis, convulsions, bleeding, etc.)? (medical_problems_from_drug_use)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation : Add up the number of items scored in the critical direction (indicating drug problems). The critical direction answer is NO for items 4 and 5 and YES for all others. The total score can range from 0 to 20. A total score of 6 or more indicates need for further evaluation for possible drug use disorder. A score of 16 or more indicates a severe drug use disorder. © Copyright 1982 by Harvey A. Skinner, PhD and the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health, Toronto, Canada. You may reproduce this instrument for noncommercial use (clinical, research, training purposes) as long as you credit the author Harvey A. Skinner, Department of Public Health Sciences, University of Toronto. (scoring_510204)

protocol.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: The 10-item Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10) includes questions about the respondent's use of drugs and related health effects and behaviors. It is used as a quantitative indicator of the respondent's drug-related problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX510301 - Patterns Of Substance Use Adolescents
form.preferredDefinition: The Monitoring the Future (MTF) project, begun in 1975, has many purposes, which include studying the changes in the beliefs, attitudes, and behavior of young people in the United States. The MTF is a repeated series of surveys in which the same segments of the population (8th, 10th, and 12th graders; college students; and young adults) are presented with the same set of questions over a period of years to see how answers change over time. MTF respondents are 8th, 10th, and 12th grade students who participate by completing self-administered, machine-readable questionnaires in their normal classrooms, administered by university personnel. The MTF questions from this module address whether the respondent has ever smoked, drunk alcohol, or used various drugs and the frequency of substance use in the last 30 days and last 12 months.

headerInstruction.text: This is not a test, so there are no right or wrong answers we would like you to work fairly quickly, so that you can finish. All the questions should be answered by marking one of the answers. If you don't always find an answer that fits exact..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: 1. Have you ever smoked cigarettes? (ever_smoked_cigarettes)
2. How frequently have you smoked cigarettes during the past 30 days? (thirthy_day_smoking_frequency)

validValue.meaningText: Less than one cigarette per day
validValue.description: Less than one cigarette per day

validValue.meaningText: One to five cigarettes per day
validValue.description: One to five cigarettes per day

validValue.meaningText: About one and one-half packs per day
validValue.description: About one and one-half packs per day

validValue.meaningText: Two packs or more per day
validValue.description: Two packs or more per day

question.questionText: 3. Have you ever taken or used smokeless tobacco (sniff, plug, dipping tobacco, chewing tobacco)? (ever_used_smokeless_tobacco)
4. How frequently have you taken smokeless tobacco during the past 30 days? (thirthy_day_smokeless_tobacco_frequency)
Next we want to ask you about drinking alcoholic beverages, including beer, wine, liquor, and any other beverage that contains alcohol. (info_alcohol_510301)
5. Have you ever had any alcoholic beverage to drink more than just a few sips? (ever_drink_alcoholic_beverage)
6a. On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink more than just a few sips in your lifetime? (lifetime_alcoholic_beverage_use)
6b. On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink more than just a few sips during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_alcoholic_beverage_use)
6c. On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink more than just a few sips during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_alcoholic_beverage_use)
7. Think back over the LAST TWO WEEKS. How many times have you had five or more drinks in a row? (last_2_weeks_5_drinks_or_more)

The next major section of this questionnaire deals with various other drugs. There is a lot of talk these days about this subject, but very little accurate information. Therefore, we still have a lot to learn about the actual experiences and attitudes of people your age. We hope that you can answer all questions but if you find one which you feel you cannot answer honestly, we would prefer that you leave it blank. Remember that your answers will be kept strictly confidential they are never connected with your name or your class. (inst2_510301)
8a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) in your lifetime? (lifetime_marijuana_hashish_use)
8b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_marijuana_hashish_use)
8c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_marijuana_hashish_use)
9a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ('acid') in your lifetime? (lifetime_lsd_use)
9b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ('acid') during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_lsd_use)
9c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ('acid') during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_lsd_use)
10a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, 'shrooms' or psilocybin PCP) in your lifetime? (lifetime_other_hallucinogen_use)
10b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, shrooms or psilocybin PCP) during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_other_hallucinogen_use)
10c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, shrooms or psilocybin PCP) during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_other_hallucinogen_use)
11a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke', 'crack', 'rock') if your lifetime? (lifetime_cocaine_use)
11b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke', 'crack', 'rock') during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_cocaine_use)
11c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke', 'crack', 'rock') during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_cocaine_use)
12a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used 'crack' (cocaine in chunk or rock form) in your lifetime? (lifetime_crack_use)
12b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used 'crack' (cocaine in chunk or rock form) during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_crack_use)
12c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used 'crack' (cocaine in chunk or rock form) during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_crack_use)
13a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form in your lifetime? (lifetime_other_cocaine_use)
13b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_other_cocaine_use)
13c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_other_cocaine_use)

Amphetamines are sometimes prescribed by doctors for people who have trouble paying attention, are hyperactive, have ADHD, or have trouble staying awake. They are sometimes called "uppers," "ups," or "pep pills," and include drugs like Adderall® and Ritalin®. Drugstores are not supposed to sell them without a prescription from a doctor. Amphetamines do NOT include any nonprescription drugs, such as overthecounter diet pills or stayawake pills. (amphet_510301)
14a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_amphetamines_use)
14b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_amphetamines_use)
14c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_amphetamines_use)
15a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used methamphetamine ('meth', 'speed', 'crank', 'crystal meth') by any method in your lifetime? (lifetime_methamphetamine_use)
15b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used methamphetamine ('meth', 'speed', 'crank', 'crystal meth') by any method during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_methamphetamine_use)
15c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used methamphetamine ('meth', 'speed', 'crank', 'crystal meth') by any method during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_methamphetamine_use)
16a. On how many occasions (if any) have you smoked (or inhaled the fumes of) crystal meth ('ice') in your lifetime? (lifetime_crystal_meth_use)
16b. On how many occasions (if any) have you smoked (or inhaled the fumes of) crystal meth ('ice') during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_crystal_meth_use)
16c. On how many occasions (if any) have you smoked (or inhaled the fumes of) crystal meth ('ice') during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_crystal_meth_use)
The next questions are about QUAALUDES (Methaqualone). Quaaludes are sometimes called: "soapers," "quads," "ludes." (ludes_510301)
17a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken Quaaludes on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_quaalude_use)
17b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken Quaaludes on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_quaalude_use)
17c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken Quaaludes on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_quaalude_use)

Sedatives, including barbiturates, are sometimes prescribed by doctors to help people relax or get to sleep. They are sometimes called "downs" or "downers," and include phenobarbital, Tuinal®, Nembutal®, and Seconal®. (sedatives_510301)
18a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken sedatives on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_sedative_use)
18b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken sedatives on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_sedative_use)
18c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken sedatives on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_sedative_use)
Tranquilizers are sometimes prescribed by doctors to calm people down, quiet their nerves, or relax their muscles. Librium®, Valium®, and Xanax® are all tranquilizers. (inst4_510301)
19a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken tranquilizers on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_tranquilizer_use)
19b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken tranquilizers on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_tranquilizer_use)
19c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken tranquilizers on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_tranquilizer_use)
20a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used heroin in your lifetime? (lifetime_heroin_use)
20b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used heroin during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_heroin_use)
20c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used heroin during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_heroin_use)
21a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin using a needle in your lifetime? (lifetime_heroin_with_needle_use)
21b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin using a needle during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_heroin_with_needle_use)
21c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin using a needle during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_heroin_with_needle_use)
22a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin WITHOUT using a needle in your lifetime? (lifetime_heroin_without_needle_use)
22b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin WITHOUT using a needle during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_heroin_without_needle_use)
22c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken heroin WITHOUT using a needle during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_heroin_without_needle_use)

There are a number of narcotics other than heroin, such as methadone, opium, morphine, codeine, Demerol®, Vicodin®, OxyContin®, and Percocet®. These are sometimes prescribed by doctors. (other_drugs_510301)
23a. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken narcotics other than heroin on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_other_narcotic_use)

23b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken narcotics other than heroin on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_other_narcotic_use)
23c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken narcotics other than heroin on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_other_narcotic_use)

24a. On how many occasions (if any) have you sniffed glue, or breathed the contents of aerosol spray cans, or inhaled any other gases or sprays in order to get high in your lifetime? (lifetime_inhaled_gas_or_spray_use)

24b. On how many occasions (if any) have you sniffed glue, or breathed the contents of aerosol spray cans, or inhaled any other gases or sprays in order to get high during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_inhaled_gas_or_spray_use)

24c. On how many occasions (if any) have you sniffed glue, or breathed the contents of aerosol spray cans, or inhaled any other gases or sprays in order to get high during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_inhaled_gas_or_spray_use)
Anabolic steroids are prescription drugs sometimes prescribed by doctors to treat certain conditions. Some athletes, and others, have used them to try to increase muscle development (steriods_510301)

25a. Anabolic steroids are prescription drugs sometimes prescribed by doctors to treat certain conditions. Some athletes, and others, have used them to try to increase muscle development. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken steroids on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (lifetime_steroid_use)
25b. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken steroids on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_steroid_use)
25c. On how many occasions (if any) have you taken steroids on your own that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_steroid_use)
26a. On how many occasions (if any) have you used MDMA ('ecstasy') in your lifetime? (lifetime_mdma_use)
26b. On how many occasions (if any) have you used MDMA ('ecstasy') during the last 12 months? (twelve_month_mdma_use)
26c. On how many occasions (if any) have you used MDMA ('ecstasy') during the last 30 days? (thirthy_day_mdma_use)
Lately there has been some attention paid to certain drugs. (inst3_510301)
27a. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken GHB ('liquid G'', 'grievous bodily harm')? (twelve_month_ghb_use)
27b. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken ketamine ('special K', 'super K')? (twelve_month_ketamine_use)
27c. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you smoked bidis (or beedies) which are small brown cigarettes from India? (twelve_month_bidis_use)
27d. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you smoked kreteks (clove cigarettes)? (twelve_month_kreteks_use)
27e. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken 'andro' (androstenedione, nonprescription steroid)? (twelve_month_andro_use)
27f. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken creatine (amino acid used to build muscles)? (twelve_month_creatine_use)
27g. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Ritalin® (without a doctor's orders)? (twelve_month_ritalin_use)
27h. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Adderall® (without a doctor's orders)? (twelve_month_adderall_use)
27i. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken OxyContin® (without a doctor's orders)? (twelve_month_oxycontin_use)
27j. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Vicodin® (without a doctor's orders)? (twelve_month_vicodin_use)
27k. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Rohypnol ('rophies', 'roofies')? (twelve_month_rohypnol_use)
27l. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken a nonprescription cough or cold medicine ('robos', 'DXM', etc.) to get high? (twelve_month_cough_or_cold_medicine_use)
27m. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Salvia? (twelve_month_salvia_use)
27n. During the LAST 12 MONTHS, on how many occasions (if any) have you taken Provigil®, a prescription stayawake drug (without a doctor's orders)? (twelve_month_provigil_use)

The next questions are about drugs that doctors sometimes prescribe for people who have problems concentrating on one task at a time (attention deficit disorder), or with being too active or too disruptive (hyperactive), or both (ADHD). Stimulanttype drugs (i.e., amphetamine, methylphrenidate, and pemoline) are prescribed for these conditions. These drugs include Ritalin®, Adderall®, Concerta®, Metadate®, Dexedrine®, Focalin®, Cylert®, and others. (adhd_drugs_510301)

28a. Have you ever taken any of these stimulanttype prescription drugs under a doctor's supervision for these conditions? (Do not count drugs that are not stimulanttype, like Strattera®, Wellbutrin®, Provigil®, Tenex®, or Tofranil®.) (prescription_stimulant_use)

validValue.meaningText: Yes, in the past, but not now
validValue.description: Yes, in the past, but not now

question.questionText: 28b. Have you ever taken a nonstimulanttype prescription drug under a doctor's supervision for these conditions (like Strattera®, Wellbutrin®, Provigil®, Tenex®, or Tofranil®)? (prescription_non_stimulant_use)

validValue.meaningText: Yes, in the past, but not now
validValue.description: Yes, in the past, but not now

question.questionText: 29. In addition to the drugs we have already asked you about, have you ever used any other drug or drugs for nonmedical reasons? If so, please write the name(s) of those drug(s) here. (other_drugs)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Monitoring the Future (MTF) project, begun in 1975, has many purposes, which include studying the changes in the beliefs, attitudes, and behavior of young people in the United States. The MTF is a repeated series of surveys in which the same segments of the population (8th, 10th, and 12th graders; college students; and young adults) are presented with the same set of questions over a period of years to see how answers change over time. MTF respondents are 8th, 10th, and 12th grade students who participate by completing self-administered, machine-readable questionnaires in their normal classrooms, administered by university personnel. The MTF questions from this module address whether the respondent has ever smoked, drunk alcohol, or used various drugs and the frequency of substance use in the last 30 days and last 12 months.

form.longName: PhenX PX510402 - Substance Abuse And Dependence Past Year Drugs
form.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about substance abuse and dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994). The questions encompass marijuana and several prescription and other illicit drug categories.

headerInstruction.text: TYPES OF MEDICINES/DRUGS 1. Sedatives, for example, sleeping pills, barbiturates, Seconal, quaaludes, or chloral hydrate2. Tranquilizers or antianxiety drugs, for example, Valium, Librium, muscle relaxants, or Xanax3. Painkillers, for example,..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Drugs
module.preferredDefinition: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Drugs

question.questionText: 1. Sedatives (sedatives)
1a. Did you use (Sedatives) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (sedatives_last12months)
2. Tranquilizers (tranquilizers)
Did you use (Tranquilizers) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (tranquilizers_last12months)
3. Painkillers (painkillers)
Did you use (Painkillers) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (painkillers_last12months)
4. Stimulants (stimulants)
Did you use (Stimulants) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (stimulants_last12months)
5. Marijuana (marijuana)
Did you use (Marijuana) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (marijuana_last12months)
6. Cocaine or Crack (cocaine)
Did you use (Cocaine or Crack) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (cocaine_last12months)
7. Hallucinogens (hallucinogens)
Did you use (Hallucinogens) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (hallucinogens_last12months)
8. Inhalants/Solvents (inhalants_solvents)
Did you use (Inhalants/Solvents) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (inhalants_solvents_last12months)
9. Heroin (heroin)
Did you use (Heroin) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (heroin_last12months)
10. Other (other)
Other, Specify #10 (other_specify)
10a. Did you use (Other) in the last 12 months only, before the last 12 months only, or during both time periods? (other_last12months)
CHECK ITEM 3.14 Are any 1's or 3's marked in the b questions above? (check_item_314)

12. Now I'm going to ask you about some experiences that people have reported in connection with their use of the medicines or drugs that we just talked about. As I read each experience, please tell me if this has ever happened to you. In your entire life, did you EVER (info_510402)
12a. Have arguments with your spouse, boyfriend/ girlfriend, family, or friends as a result of your medicine or drug use? (entirelife_arguments_familyfriends_aboutdruguse)
Did #12a happen in the last 12 months? (arguments_familyfriends_aboutdruguse_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12a happen with? (arguments_familyfriends_last12months)
12b. Get into physical fights while under the influence of a medicine or drug? (entirelife_physical_fights)
Did #12b happen in the last 12 months? (pxt510402_physical_fights_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12b happen with? (physical_fights_last12months_510402)
12c. Continue to use a medicine or drug even though you knew it was causing you trouble with your family and friends? (entirelife_continueusing_familyproblems)
Did #12c happen in the last 12 months? (continueusing_familyproblems_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12c happen with? (cont_familyproblems_last12months)

12d. Have job or school troubles as a result of your medicine or drug use like missing too much work, not doing your work well, being demoted or losing a job, or being suspended, expelled or dropping out of school? (entirelife_job_school_troubles)
Did #12d happen in the last 12 months? (job_school_troubles_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12d happen with? (job_school_troubles_last12months_510402)
12e. Have a period when your medicine or drug use or your being sick from your medicine or drug use often interfered with taking care of your home or family? (entirelife_prevent_homefamily_care)
Did #12e happen in the last 12 months? (prevent_homefamily_care_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12e happen with? (prevent_homefamily_care_last12months_510402)

12f. Accidentally injure yourself while under the influence of a medicine or drug, for example, have a bad fall or cut yourself badly, get hurt in a traffic accident or anything like that? (entirelife_injure_self)
Did #12f happen in the last 12 months? (injure_self_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12f happen with? (injure_self_last12months_510402)
12g. More than once drive a car, motorcycle, truck, boat, or other vehicle when you were under the influence of a medicine or drug? (entirelife_morethanonce_drivewhiledrinking)
Did #12g happen in the last 12 months? (morethanonce_drivewhiledrinking_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12g happen with? (morethanonce_drivewhiledrinking_last12months_510402)

12h. Find yourself under the influence of a medicine or drug or feeling its aftereffects in situations that increased your chances of getting hurt like swimming, using machinery, or walking in a dangerous area or around heavy traffic? (entirelife_situations_forgettinghurt)
Did #12h happen in the last 12 months? (situations_forgettinghurt_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12h happen with? (situations_forgettinghurt_last12months_510402)
12i. Get arrested, get held at a police station or have any other legal problems because of your medicine or drug use? (entirelife_legaltrouble)
Did #12i happen in the last 12 months? (legaltrouble_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #12i happen with? (legaltrouble_last12months_510402)
13. Now I'm going to ask you about some OTHER experiences you may have had with medicines and drugs. In your ENTIRE LIFE, did you EVER (instructions_13_510402)
13a. More than once want to stop or cut down on using any of these medicines or drugs? (entirelife_wanttostop_cutdown)
Did #13a happen in the last 12 months? (wanttostop_cutdown_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13a happen with? (wanttostop_cutdown_last12months_510402)
13b. More than once try to stop or cut down on using any of these medicines or drugs but found you couldn't do it? (entirelife_trytostop_cutdown)
Did #13b happen in the last 12 months? (trytostop_cutdown_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13b happen with? (trytostop_cutdown_last12months_510402)
13c. Often use a medicine or drug in larger amounts or for a much longer period than you meant to? (entirelife_largeramount_longerperiod)
Did #13c happen in the last 12 months? (largeramount_longerperiod_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13c happen with? (largeramount_longerperiod_last12months_510402)
13d. Have a period when you spent a lot of time using a medicine or drug or getting over its bad aftereffects? (entirelife_lotoftime_using_gettingover)
Did #13d happen in the last 12 months? (lotoftime_using_gettingover_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13d happen with? (lotoftime_using_gettingover_last12months_510402)
13e. Have a period when you spent a lot of time making sure you always had enough of a medicine or drug available? (entirelife_lotoftime_ensurehadenough)
Did #13e happen in the last 12 months? (lotoftime_ensurehadenough_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13e happen with? (lotoftime_ensurehadenough_last12months_510402)

13f. In your entire life, did you ever have any of the following bad aftereffects when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off? This includes the morning after using it or in the first few days after stopping or cutting down on it. For example, did you EVER..... (instructions_13f_510402)
13f1. Sleep more than usual? (entirelife_sleep_more)
Did #13f1 happen in the last 12 months? (sleep_more_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f1 happen with? (sleep_more_last12months_501402)
13f2. Feel weak or tired (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_feel_weak)
Did #13f2 happen in the last 12 months? (feel_weak_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #132 happen with? (feel_weak_last12months_5010402)
13f3. Feel depressed? (entirelife_depressed)
Did #13f3 happen in the last 12 months? (depressed_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f3 happen with? (depressed_last12months_510402)
13f4. Find yourself sweating or your heart beating fast (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_sweating_rapidheartbeat)
Did #13f4 happen in the last 12 months? (sweating_rapidheartbeat_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f4 happen with? (sweating_rapidheartbeat_last12months_510402)
13f5. Have nausea, vomiting or a stomach ache? (entirelife_nausea_vomiting)
Did #13f5 happen in the last 12 months? (nausea_vomiting_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f5 happen with? (nausea_vomiting_last12months_510402)
13f6. Yawn a lot (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_yawn)
Did #13f6 happen in the last 12 months? (yawn_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f6 happen with? (yawn_last12months_510402)
13f7. Have runny eyes or a runny nose? (entirelife_runnynose)
Did #13f7 happen in the last 12 months? (runnynose_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f7 happen with? (runnynose_last12months_510402)
13f8. Eat more than usual or gain weight (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_eatmore)
Did #13f8 happen in the last 12 months? (eatmore_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f8 happen with? (eatmore_last12months_510402)
13f9. Feel anxious or nervous? (entirelife_anxious)
Did #13f9 happen in the last 12 months? (anxious_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f9 happen with? (anxious_last12months_510402)
13f10. Have muscle aches or cramps or diarrhea (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_muscleaches)
Did #13f10 happen in the last 12 months? (muscleaches_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f10 happen with? (muscleaches_last12months_510402)
13f11. Have a fever? (entirelife_fever)
Did #13f11 happen in the last 12 months? (fever_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f11 happen with? (fever_last12months_510402)
13f12. Became so restless you fidgeted, paced or couldn't sit still (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_fidget)
Did #13f12 happen in the last 12 months? (fidget_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f12 happen with? (fidget_last12months_510402)
13f13. Move or talk much more slowly than usual? (entirelife_moveslowly)
Did #13f13 happen in the last 12 months? (moveslowly_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f13 happen with? (moveslowly_last12months_510402)
13f14. Find yourself sweating, your pupils dilating or your hair standing up (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_pupilsdilate)
Did #13f14 happen in the last 12 months? (pupilsdilate_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #`13f14 happen with? (pupilsdilate_last12months_510402)
13f15. Have unpleasant dreams that often seemed real? (entirelife_unpleasantdreams)
Did #13f15 happen in the last 12 months? (unpleasantdreams_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f15 happen with? (unpleasantdreams_last12months_510402)
13f16. See, feel or hear things that weren't really there (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_hallucinate)
Did #13f16 happen in the last 12 months? (hallucinate_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did 13f16 happen with? (hallucinate_last12months_510402)
13f17. Find yourself shaking? (entirelife_shaking)
Did #13f17 happen in the last 12 months? (shaking_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f17 happen with? (shaking_last12months_510402)
13f18. Have trouble falling asleep or staying asleep (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_troublefallingasleep)
Did #13f18 happen in the last 12 months? (troublefallingasleep_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f18 happen with? (troublefallingasleep_last12months_510402)
13f19. Have fits or seizures? (entirelife_seizures)
Did #13f19 happen in the last 12 months? (seizures_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f19 happen with? (seizures_last12months_510402)
13f20. Have very bad headaches (when the effects of a medicine or drug were wearing off)? (entirelife_headaches)
Did #13f20 happen in the last 12 months? (headaches_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13f20 happen with? (headaches_last12months_510402)
13g. Take more of the same or a similar medicine or drug to get over or avoid any of these bad aftereffects? (entirelife_takemoredrugs_aftereffects)
Did #13g happen in the last 12 months? (takemoredrugs_aftereffects_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13g happen with? (takemoredrugs_aftereffects_last12months_510402)
13h. Find that your usual amount of a medicine or drug had much less effect on you than it once did? (entirelife_usualamount_lesseffect)
Did #13h happen in the last 12 months? (usualamount_lesseffect_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13h happen with? (usualamount_lesseffect_last12months_510402)
13i. Find that you had to use much more of a medicine or drug than you once did to get the effect you wanted? (entirelifemoredrugs_desiredeffects)
Did #13i happen in the last 12 months? (moredrugs_desiredeffects_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13i happen with? (moredrugs_desiredeffects_last12months_510402)

13j. Give up or cut down on activities that were important to you in order to use a medicine or drug like work, school, or associating with friends or relatives? (entirelife_giveupimportantactivities_usedrugs)
Did #13j happen in the last 12 months? (giveupimportantactivities_usedrugs_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13j happen with? (giveupimportantactivities_usedrugs_last12months_510402)
13k. Give up or cut down on activities that you were interested in or that gave you pleasure in order to use a medicine or drug? (entirelife_giveupinterestedactivities_usedrugs)
Did #13k happen in the last 12 months? (giveupinterestedactivities_usedrugs_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13k happen with? (giveupinterestedactivities_usedrugs_last12months_510402)

13l. Continue to use a medicine or drug even though it was making you feel depressed, uninterested in things, or suspicious or distrustful of other people? (entirelife_continueuse_depressedsuspicious)
Did #13l happen in the last 12 months? (continueuse_depressedsuspicious_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13l happen with? (continueuse_depressedsuspicious_last12months_510402)
13m. Continue to use a medicine or drug even though you knew it was causing you a health problem or making a health problem worse? (entirelife_continueuse_healthproblem)
Did #13m happen in the last 12 months? (continueuse_healthproblem_last12months)
During the last 12 months, which medicines or drugs did #13m happen with? (continueuse_healthproblem_last12months_510402)

protocol.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about substance abuse and dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994). The questions encompass marijuana and several prescription and other illicit drug categories.
